channel.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2013 Cable News Network LP, LLLP.

image.title: CNN.com - Top Stories
image.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

item.title: Judge lifts Oscar Pistorius' travel ban
item.description: Lawyers for South African track star Oscar Pistorius, charged with killing girlfriend Reeva Steenkamp, argued in court Thursday for more lenient bail restrictions, including permission to travel overseas.

item.title: Tight security as banks open
item.description: Cyprus banks reopen today under tight security and strict, "draconian" measures. Ivan Watson reports live from the scene.

item.title: Death threat for Sarkozy probe judge
item.description: The judge who placed former French President Nicolas Sarkozy under formal investigation for breach of trust has received a written death threat with blank cartridges in the mail at his office in Bordeaux, a spokeswoman for a magistrates' union said Thursday.

item.title: Doctor killed patients to free up beds
item.description: A Brazilian doctor appeared in court for allegedly killing seven patients to free up hospital beds in the southeast city of Curitiba.

item.title: Berezovsky had ligature around neck
item.description: The body of expatriate Russian tycoon Boris Berezovsky was found in a bathroom at his British home with a ligature around his neck, a police officer told an inquest into his death Thursday.

item.title: China media blasts 'arrogant' Apple
item.description: State-run media in China has lambasted Apple Inc. for "unparalleled arrogance" over alleged complaints about customer service in China.

item.title: Street View maps nuclear ghost town
item.description: Cars remain where they were crushed by falling walls two years ago, drink vending machines stand in gloomy isolation outside shuttered shops and traffic lights still blink amber in deserted streets.

item.title: Massive cyberattack hits Internet users
item.description: Internet users around the globe were facing slowed down service thanks to what's being called the biggest cyber attack in history.

item.title: Rubber bullets fired at Myanmar rioters
item.description: Riots broke out in central Myanmar on Wednesday, authorities said, as police struggled to stop groups of Buddhists from setting fire to mosques and Muslims' homes.

item.title: Suspect cried before mass shooting
item.description: Jared Loughner broke down and cried to an Arizona Game and Fish officer when he was pulled over for running a red light just hours before his 2011 shooting rampage, according to investigative documents released Wednesday.

item.title: Al-Assad to BRICS: Stop helping rebels
item.description: Embattled Syrian President Bashar al-Assad on Wednesday called on leaders from Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa to help staunch the flow of money and weapons to rebels in the 2-year-old civil war.

item.title: 30 bruises found on dead adopted boy
item.description: Max Shatto, a 3-year-old child adopted from Russia by a Texas couple, had more than 30 bruises on his body in various stages of healing when he was pronounced dead on January 21, according to an Ector County medical examiner's autopsy report obtained by CNN.

item.title: Green light for US-American merger
item.description: A bankruptcy judge gave American Airlines the OK to merge with US Airways. CNN's Lisa Sylvester reports.

item.title: Homes at risk from huge landslide
item.description: One home is destroyed and more than a dozen are in danger after a massive landslide on Whidbey Island in Washington.

item.title: Pope Francis shuns luxury papal home
item.description: Pope Francis has decided not to move into the papal apartment used by Benedict XVI and others before him, preferring instead to stay in a simple suite at a Vatican hotel, a Vatican spokesman said.

item.title: Damaged Picasso bought for $155M
item.description: Billionaire Steve Cohen has reportedly bought a famous Picasso for possibly a record price. CNN's Alina Cho reports.

item.title: We need an Arms Trade Treaty now
item.description: During a recent trip to South Sudan, I was reminded of my childhood and the challenges I have had to overcome. I grew up in western Africa, in the Republic of Benin, where I distinctly remember the atmosphere of unrest that came with two coups d'etats. In flashbacks, I remember my mother carrying me on her back as we fled Cotonou, the capital of Benin, while gunshots and screams filled the air.

item.title: What next for Petraeus -- president?
item.description: David Petraeus, who has wandered for months in his own private wilderness, is superbly poised for a major comeback.

item.title: NK saber-rattling: Erratic, staged?
item.description: North Korea's saber rattling again shook the world Wednesday. Pyongyang vowed to shut down a key military hotline with South Korea.

item.title: Down to earth after 449 days up tree
item.description: As the sun sets, clouds of smoke begin to glow deep orange and pink. I watch as flames leap from the dark silhouettes of trees and embers are flung high into the night sky.

item.title: What are next emerging economies?
item.description: As leaders of Brazil, Russia, India, China and South Africa convene in Durban, the term "BRICS" used to describe these rapidly growing economies is so last year; today everyone is talking about the "CIVETS."

item.title: Cyprus: Design of future bailouts?
item.description: CNN's Richard Quest explains the Cyprus bailout template.

item.title: U.S. sends stealth bombers to South Korea as tensions rise
item.description: The United States sent stealth bombers to South Korea to participate in annual military drills amid rising tensions with North Korea, the U.S. military says.

item.title: Five things to know: N. Korea threats
item.description: Video propaganda showing the White House and Congress being blown up. Talk of hitting U.S. bases in the Pacific. The renunciation of a 60-year-old armistice that has kept the tenuous peace on the Korean Peninsula.

item.title: N. Korea: Nuclear war 'simmering'
item.description: CNN's Chris Lawrence reports on the latest threats coming from North Korean state TV and what the rhetoric means.

item.title: 'North Korea is not a paper tiger'
item.description: North Korea's threat-of-the-day pattern prompts White House criticism as the nation severs a critical military hotline with South Korea amid high tensions.

item.title: Photos: Kim Jong Un and the military
Timeline: War of words
item.description: North Korea upped the ante Tuesday in its war of words, threatening to target South Korea and U.S. military bases.

item.title: Majority skeptical of marriage law
item.description: The U.S. Supreme Court is set for a second day of arguments on the constitutionality of a federal law that defines marriage as only between a man and a woman.

item.title: 5 key issues
item.description: The question of same-sex marriage went before the U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday in the first of two oral arguments this week on separate appeals.

item.title: 'Pray' plea as Mandela hospitalized
item.description: South African President Jacob Zuma asks people to pray for former leader Nelson Mandela after he was admitted to hospital with a recurring lung infection.

item.title: Nelson Mandela rushed to hospital
item.description: Former South African president Nelson Mandela being treated for lung infection.

item.title: What does Mandela mean to you?
item.description: To mark Nelson Mandela's birthday, we asked what the former South African president means to you. The response on social media has been overwhelming.

item.title: S. Africa reveals Mandela banknotes
item.description: When South Africans open their wallets, they will be greeted by images of a smiling Nelson Mandela in various denominations.

item.title: Tracking huge great white shark
item.description: Here's a view from aboard a fishing boat of what it's like to nab and tag a great white shark for research purposes.

item.title: Becker: Ronaldo the tennis ace?
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo has the perfect physique for tennis, according to tennis great Boris Becker.

item.title: 'Miniature TV' in your tummy
item.description: PillCam is a ingestible video camera with a transmitter which lets doctors look inside your digestive tract.

item.title: The man behind 'Lara Croft'
item.description: Ian Livingstone is a legend in the fantasy games world. In 1995, he stumbled upon "Lara Croft" and the rest is history.

item.title: Rodman: Kim Jong Un 'my friend'
item.description: Ato Boldon, Politico's Ben Smith and Reihan Salam discuss criticism over Dennis Rodman's trip to North Korea.

item.title: Marcel Desailly's Ghana regret
item.description: French World Cup winning defender Marcel Desailly tells CNN that he would have loved to play for Ghana at least once.

item.title: 'Batman' helps UK police
item.description: A costumed crusader brought in a man wanted for burglary.

item.title: Go inside a sinkhole
item.description: Ever wonder what a sinkhole looks like on the inside? CNN's David Mattingly dives in for a peek in Florida.

item.title: The circus family raised on a boat
item.description: From the top of a 14-meter mast, Delphine Lechifflart expertly rolls down a length of white ribbon, her taut body pirouetting mid-air, before easing into the arms of her lover.

item.title: One banknote = 26,000 bacteria
item.description: If you thought dirty money was only found in offshore bank accounts, check your wallet instead. But you may want to wash your hands afterward.

item.title: Photographer sorry for pyramid photos
item.description: Was it the ultimate adventure or an audacious act of disrespect that should be punished by law?

item.title: Vera Wang drops $500 China try-on fee
item.description: U.S. luxury bridal designer Vera Wang's first store in China has gotten off to an unfashionable start. Amid cries of discrimination, the company announced Wednesday it would scrap a controversial policy of charging customers a nearly $500 fee to try on clothes.

item.title: See how dolphin mourns baby
item.description: A dolphin off Dana Point, California, is seen mourning her baby dolphin by carrying it on her back while swimming.

item.title: Amanda Knox case a 'complicated mess'
item.description: How come Amanda Knox and Raffaele Sollecito are back to square one in the Meredith Kercher murder trial?

item.title: Is this penthouse world's priciest?
item.description: This apartment will possibly be the most expensive penthouse in the world when it's completed. It has its own waterslide.

item.title: Long on lyrics, short on rehab
item.description: Is there a stigma about discussing coming clean in a musical genre that many feel has promoted drug use?

item.title: Rapping about drugs
item.description: Is there a stigma about coming clean in a music g

item.title: Somali rappers defy bullets, death threats
item.description: The jarring sounds of war have long echoed over Mogadishu. Now it's time for music to rock the Somali capital.

item.title: Rappers risk lives for peace
item.description: In pictures: Somali rappers risk lives for peace

item.title: China's Michelle Obama?
item.description: Wives of Chinese leaders usually stand in the background, but Peng Liyuan is no ordinary First Lady.

item.title: Would Syria use chemical weapons?
item.description: Few munitions evoke as much fear as chemical weapons, which, unlike nuclear weapons, are relatively inexpensive to develop and stockpile. So does Syria have them and, if so, would it put them to use?

item.title: Should Beckham have moved to PSG?
item.description: Catch all the CNN FC off-field talk, as Pedro Pinto, Ian Wright and others discuss Becks' career as well as racism in football.

item.title: Nadal doing nada: Star unwinds in Mexico
item.description: Don Riddell joins tennis star Rafa Nadal as he unwinds between tournaments in Mexico. Airs in full Thurs 21, 1730 CET

item.title: Plane campaign: Does sexy sell seats?
item.description: Images of bikini-clad women in Thailand posing suggestively in an online ad for a local airline inflamed passions -- both positive and negative -- earlier this year.

item.title: What Mick Jagger is teaching his children
item.description: Ruben Navarrette says being a good parent is about teaching adult children to stand on their own two feet.

item.title: When Princess Diana and Travolta danced
item.description: Sumptuous velvet, delicate sequins, intricate beading: They are dresses fit for a princess -- Princess Diana, that is -- and if you've got a big pocketbook (with a designer label, naturally), they could have been yours.

item.title: Decision-making robots -- here to help
item.description: Despite most humans' land-centric view, Earth is an ocean planet. The global ocean covers more than two-thirds of our planet's surface and makes life as we know it possible: it produces half of the oxygen we breathe, helps regulate our climate and provides the single largest habitat for life on Earth.

item.title: The mysterious Great Barrier Reef
item.description: Philippe Cousteau goes on a special underwater expedition to learn more about the Great Barrier Reef.

item.title: Grisly crime wave in Mexico drug war
item.description: It was a staggering sight, even in a Mexican city that has seen its share of violence in recent years as drug-related crimes surged.

item.title: Parenting a child with no future
item.description: What does being a mother mean when your baby is dying? How do you parent a child with no future? These questions needle the reader throughout Emily Rapp's moving and beautiful new book, "The Still Point of the Turning World."

item.title: Same-sex marriage debate goes on
item.description: After two days of hearings, the U.S. Supreme Court faces one of the top social issues of this era -- the right of gay and lesbian couples to wed.

item.title: Plague of locusts infest Madagascar
item.description: Half of Madagascar is infested by a plague of locusts, a crisis that officials warn could get worse -- spreading to two-thirds of the island nation and, without action, potentially lingering for 10 years -- without an immediate and effective response.

item.title: Dead ducks found in China
item.description: Thousands of dead ducks found in two Chinese rivers raise concerns over food safety. CNN's David Mckenzie reports.

item.title: Scientists close in on invisibility cloak
item.description: Some scientists seem to take their cues from science fiction or fantasy novels.

item.title: Pope turns down spacious flat
item.description: Pope Francis prefers his modest suite over the official residence, CNN's Ben Wedeman reports.

item.title: 'Murder capital' of the world is ...?
item.description: It is night time as a pack of masked soldiers troop silently toward the front line of a deadly shootout between law enforcement officials and unknown gunmen in a dimly-lit Honduras neighborhood.

item.title: Chihuahua saves girl from pit bull
item.description: A Chihuahua showed big courage when he came to the rescue of a little girl being attacked by a pit bull. CTV reports.

item.title: Footballer sorry for sexist jibe
item.description: Embroiled by successive racism scandals throughout much of the season, football was engulfed in a sexism storm on Wednesday after a leading ex-French international footballer advised women to look after their "pots and pans" rather than talk about the sport.

item.title: CNN FC: Beckham gamble
item.description: CNN FC welcomes Ian Wright and Andy Brassell to the show to discuss David Beckham's move to PSG and racism in football.

item.title: Safety for child suicide bombers
item.description: CNN gets rare access at one center rehabilitating children whom the Taliban has trained to be bombers.

item.title: Who really killed Osama bin Laden?
item.description: A member of the secretive SEAL Team 6 tells CNN a previous account of Osama bin Laden's shooting is wrong.

item.title: Hindus celebrate Festival of Colors
item.description: Hindus celebrate Holi, the Festival of Colors

item.title: Viagra: The little blue pill that could
item.description: Fifteen years ago, men who were suffering from impotence received a beacon of hope in the form of a little blue pill.

item.title: Human traffic: Lost boys
item.description: Some of the world's soccer stars started out in the Mondial Minimes tournament. Now it is being used to highlight the dangers of trafficking from Africa.

item.title: Iraq War: Should Bush, Blair be charged?
item.description: It is time for Bush and Blair to be thoroughly investigated for the 'tawdry tale' of the Iraq War, UK lawyer says.

item.title: Photographer shares memories
item.description: Ten years since the U.S. invasion, photojournalist Peter Turnley shares his collection of images from the Iraq War.

item.title: 'I'd rather he was dead than arrested'
item.description: Family and friends focus on one goal: Identify the individual who can help free him in return for money.

item.title: Fear, despair as Cyprus faces future
item.description: "It is a jungle. It is a jungle and we are the rabbit surrounded by lions," said the taxi driver. It's a picture that sums up Cypriots' disgust and helplessness at what they see as the ultimate betrayal by the EU.

item.title: What is North Korea's Kim Jong Un up to?
item.description: N. Korea's nuclear tests, and the annulment of the 1953 armistice raise questions about its leader. But is his behavior erratic or staged?

item.title: War: An unthinkable scenario?
item.description: It's Asia's nightmare scenario: War on the Korean peninsula. What might happen if the unthinkable occurs? While no analysts believe "Korean War II" is imminent, many question Kim Jong Un's rationality.

item.title: Korea crisis
item.description: It's Asia's nightmare scenario: War on the Korean peninsula. What might happen if the unthinkable occurs?

item.title: Who killed bin Laden?
item.description: CNN exclusive: A member of the secretive SEAL Team 6 tells CNN that a previous account of Osama bin Laden's shooting is completely wrong.

item.title: Same-sex marriage
item.description: The meaning of marriage and the implications of expanding that right to gays and lesbians is now squarely before the U.S. Supreme Court.

item.title: Amanda Knox
item.description: How come Amanda Knox and Raffaele Sollecito are back to square one in the Meredith Kercher murder trial?

item.title: Pope support
item.description: Two priests say Pope Francis protected fellow Jesuits from the Argentinean military. CNN's Rafael Romo reports.

item.title: Facebook futures?
item.description: Social media sites have become the global equivalent of the office watercooler, but could the buzz they generate be analyzed to predict real-world outcomes? Economist Noreena Hertz thinks so.

item.title: Oceans on brink of collapse
item.description: As the human footprint has spread, the remaining wildernesses on our planet have retreated. However, dive just a few meters below the ocean surface and you will enter a world where humans very rarely venture.

item.title: Why oceans can't wait
item.description: My grandfather Jacques Cousteau and my father Philippe dedicated their lives to revealing the ocean's wonders and helping us understand our connection to this vast expanse of water. Their work inspired generations and filled people with awe.

item.title: Modeling Earth's ecosystems
item.description: A group of researchers is building a comprehensive model of the Earth's ecosystems to help predict climate change.

item.title: Robots probe ocean depths
item.description: Despite most humans' land-centric view, Earth is an ocean planet. The global ocean covers more than two-thirds of our planet's surface and makes life as we know it possible: it produces half of the oxygen we breathe, helps regulate our climate and provides the single largest habitat for life on Earth.

item.title: Hong Kong: Ivory's Fort Knox
item.description: Hong Kong is fast becoming the Fort Knox of ivory.

item.title: Global warming increases pollen
item.description: With global warming, temperature extremes are becoming a norm -- and that's bad news for allergy sufferers.

item.title: World rejects polar bear plan
item.description: A U.S. plan to give new protection to polar bears was voted down Thursday at an international conference on endangered species.

item.title: Study warns global warming 'epic'
item.description: Global warming has propelled Earth's climate from one of its coldest decades since the last ice age to one of its hottest -- in just one century.

item.title: Philippines taps into geothermal
item.description: Eco Solutions looks at how the Philippines is tapping into its geothermal potential.

item.title: Macau's motorcycles go electric
item.description: A Macau company's love for motorcycles is helping the planet at the same time. CNN's Andrew Stevens reports.

item.title: Environmentalists fill U.S. National Mall
item.description: Marching, dancing and poster-waving environmentalists chanting "Hey, Obama. We don't want no climate drama," packed several blocks on and around Washington's National Mall on Sunday, hoping to spur President Barack Obama to take strong measures against climate change.

item.title: China's glamorous First Lady
item.description: China's new First Lady is poised to impress--and burnish China's image overseas.

item.title: Next stop Tanzania on Xi tour
item.description: CNN's David McKenzie explains why Chinese President Xi Jinping is stopping by Tanzania on his first foreign tour.

item.title: Xi starts foreign tour in Moscow
item.description: China's President Xi Jinping's choice of Moscow as his first foreign capital visit is being seen by analysts as a symbolic move that demonstrates the increasing interdependence of the one-time Cold War foes.

item.title: 2016: China to overtake U.S.
item.description: China is on track for a fourth consecutive decade of rapid growth and will overtake the US as the world's biggest economy in 2016 after accounting for price differences, according to a new report by the OECD.

item.title: China's workforce at a crossroads
item.description: China's extraordinary climb to the world's second largest economy was built on the back of Chinese workers, many of whom left rural farms to migrate for work in coastal factories.

item.title: Chinese bowl sells for $2.2 million
item.description: A rare Chinese bowl bought for about $3 from a yard sale in the U.S. sold for $2.2 million at an auction in New York on Tuesday.

item.title: Pollution 'an economic concern'
item.description: CNN's Philippe Cousteau speaks about Chinese pollution and what can be done to clean up the environmental problems.

item.title: Hollywood dream lost in translation
item.description: When China's most successful homegrown movie went on international release last month, hopes were high that the slapstick comedy, which has drawn comparisons with "The Hangover," would blaze a trail for Chinese-language cinema.
